Package io.xlorey.FluxLoader.client.ui.components

Class BaseElement

java.lang.Object
zombie.ui.UIElement
io.xlorey.FluxLoader.client.ui.components.BaseElement
Direct Known Subclasses:
Panel
public class BaseElement extends zombie.ui.UIElement
Basic UI element, which is the basis for other custom UI elements

    • isPressed

      public boolean isPressed()
      Checks whether the left mouse button is pressed (LMB)
      Returns:
      true if LMB is pressed, otherwise false

    • setClickSound

      public void setClickSound(String clickSound)
      Setting the sound that will be played when you click on an element
      Parameters:
      clickSound - sound name, default "UIActivateButton"

    • onClick

      public void onClick()
      Calls the click processing function, if specified

    • setClickFunction

      public void setClickFunction(Runnable function)
      Sets the function that will be executed when clicked. This method allows you to specify a function (action) that will be called upon a click event. The function is passed as an object that implements the Runnable interface. Once installed, this function can be called by the onClick() method.
      Parameters:
      function - Functional interface Runnable defining the action to perform when clicked.

    • onMouseDown

      public Boolean onMouseDown(double posX, double posY)
      Handles the left mouse button press event
      Overrides:
      onMouseDown in class zombie.ui.UIElement
      Parameters:
      posX - The horizontal X coordinate of the mouse cursor at the moment of clicking
      posY - The vertical Y coordinate of the mouse cursor at the moment of clicking
      Returns:
      Returns the result of calling the underlying event implementation

    • update

      public void update()
      Update element every frame
      Overrides:
      update in class zombie.ui.UIElement

    • createChildren

      public void createChildren()
      Creates and configures child elements. This method provides the ability to initialize and configure child elements. By default, the method is empty, but it can be overridden in subclasses to add specific logic for creating and configuring child elements.

    • addToScreen

      public void addToScreen()
      Adds the current element to the screen. This method registers the element with the user interface manager (UIManager), which makes it visible and active on the screen.

    • removeFromScreen

      public void removeFromScreen()
      Removes the current item from the screen. This method removes an element from the UI Manager (UIManager), which makes it invisible and inactive on the screen.

    • prerender

      public void prerender()
      Method for pre-rendering, called every frame before main rendering

    • render

      public void render()
      The process of rendering an element, called every frame
      Overrides:
      render in class zombie.ui.UIElement

    • drawRect

      public void drawRect(int posX, int posY, int width, int height, float r, float g, float b, float a)
      Draws a rectangle of the specified color and transparency.
      Parameters:
      posX - the horizontal X coordinate of the top left corner of the rectangle.
      posY - the vertical Y coordinate of the upper left corner of the rectangle.
      width - the width of the rectangle in pixels.
      height - the height of the rectangle in pixels.
      r - red component of the color, value from 0.0 to 1.0.
      g - green component of the color, value from 0.0 to 1.0.
      b - blue component of the color, value from 0.0 to 1.0.
      a - the alpha component for transparency, a value from 0.0 (fully transparent) to 1.0 (fully opaque).

    • drawRectBorder

      public void drawRectBorder(int posX, int posY, int width, int height, float r, float g, float b, float a)
      Draws the borders of a rectangle of the specified color and transparency.
      Parameters:
      posX - the horizontal X coordinate of the top left corner of the rectangle.
      posY - the vertical Y coordinate of the upper left corner of the rectangle.
      width - the width of the rectangle in pixels.
      height - the height of the rectangle in pixels.
      r - red component of the color, value from 0.0 to 1.0.
      g - green component of the color, value from 0.0 to 1.0.
      b - blue component of the color, value from 0.0 to 1.0.
      a - the alpha component for transparency, a value from 0.0 (fully transparent) to 1.0 (fully opaque).

    • isHovered

      public boolean isHovered()
      Checks if the mouse cursor is over an element.
      Returns:
      true if the element is hovered, otherwise false.
